t: “When*pn Israel was*i a child, I loved him, And*ld out of Egypt I called My son.
As*ild they called them, So*ld they went from them; They*ld sacrificed to the Baals, And*ld burned incense to carved images.
“I*ln taught Ephraim to walk, Taking*ld them by their arms; But*ld they did not know that I healed them.
I*ld drew them with gentle cords, With*ld bands of love, And*ld I was to them as those who take the yoke from their neck. I*ld stooped and*i fed them.
“He*ln shall not return to the land of Egypt; But*ld the Assyrian shall be his king, Because*ld they refused to repent.
And*ld the sword shall slash in his cities, Devour*ld his districts, And*ld consume them,*i Because*ld of their own counsels.
My*ld people are bent on backsliding from Me. Though*ld they call to the Most High, None*ld at all exalt Him.*i
“How*ln can I give you up, Ephraim? How*ild can I hand you over, Israel? How*ld can I make you like Admah? How*ild can I set you like Zeboiim? My*ld heart churns within Me; My*ld sympathy is stirred.
I*ld will not execute the fierceness of My anger; I*ld will not again destroy Ephraim. For*ld I am*i God, and not man, The*ld Holy One in your midst; And*ld I will not come with terror.
“They*ln shall walk after the Lord.*s He*ld will roar like a lion. When*ld He roars, Then*ld His*i sons shall come trembling from the west;
They*ld shall come trembling like a bird from Egypt, Like*ld a dove from the land of Assyria. And*ld I will let them dwell in their houses,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
“Ephraim*pn has encircled Me with lies, And*ld the house of Israel with deceit; But*ld Judah still walks with God, Even*ld with the Holy One who*i is*i faithful.
